elevator
Class Elevator

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--elevator.Elevator
public class Elevator
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a state of components of one elevator, i.e. the motor, the elevator cabin, the door and the scale, and provides methods for inspecting and altering the state.

An object with this class holds the following state components:

  • The current state of the elevator motor which can be in one of three possible states: (i) stopped, (ii) moving the cabin upwards, (iii) moving the cabin downwards.
  • The current y-position of the elevator cabin.
  • The current state of the door which can be in one of six different states reflecting different "degree of openness" of the door from "completely open" to "completely closed".
  • The current direction of the movement of the door (opening, closing, still).
  • The current position of the elevator scale (the level indicator)

Version:
1.0
Author:
Vlad Vlassov, IMIT/KTH, Stockholm, Sweden
See Also:
Elevator

Constructor Summary
Elevator(int number)
          Constructs an instance of Elevator that represents the elevator with the given number.
 
Method Summary
 int Getdir()
          Returns the current direction of movement of the elevator cabin (motor), e.g. 1 (upwards), -1 (downwards), 0(stopped).
 int Getdoor()
          Returns the current direction of movement of the door, e.g. 1 (opening), -1 (closing), 0 (still).
 int Getdoorstat()
          Returns the current state of the door (DoorStatus.OPEN1, ...
 double Getpos()
          Returns the current position of the elevator cabin.
 int Getscalepos()
          Returns the current position (level) of the elevator scale.
 void Setdir(int d)
          Sets the direction of the motor to the specified direction, e.g. moving downwards (-1), moving upwards (1), none = stopped (0).
 void Setdoor(int d)
          Sets the movement direction of the door to the specified direction, e.g. closing (-1), opening (1), still (0)
 void Setdoorstat(int s)
          Sets the state of the door to the specified state (DoorStatus.OPEN1, ...
 void Setpos(double f)
          Sets position of the elevator cabin to the specified double value.
 void Setscale(javax.swing.JComponent s)
          Sets a GUI component (e.g. gauge) with the javax.swing.JComponent class used to display the scale value of this Elevator.
 void Setscalepos(int s)
          Sets the scale position to the specified value (level number).
 void Setwin(javax.swing.JComponent w)
          Sets a GUI component (window) with the javax.swing.JComponent class used to display this Elevator.

Constructor Detail

Elevator

public Elevator(int number)
Constructs an instance of Elevator that represents the elevator with the given number. Sets the position of the elevator cabin at the bottom floor, sets the value of the elevator scale to the bottom floor number.
Parameters:
number - the integer number of the elevator represented by this Elevator

Parameters:
s - the integer state code to be set.
